intro: Tutcheria taiwanica, commonly known as the Taiwan tutcheria, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a mild aromatic scent. Tutcheria taiwanica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks.
